title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી શ્યામ સોરઠ પધાર્યા, જનને મન મોદ વધાર્યા; 
ગામેગામમાં દેઈ દર્શન<RHYME_211960>, કરે જનનાં મન પ્રસન<RHYME_211960>.
gujarati.context: The soul, like the Shyam sorority, rises and fills one's heart with joy; in the world, seeing the divine vision, one's mind is at peace.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
ખંભાળું રાયપર પિંપળ<RHYME_211961>, રહી બંધિયે ગયા ગોંડળ<RHYME_211961>; 
ગામ ગોંડળનો જે રાજન<RHYME_211962>, નામ હઠીભાઈ હરિજન<RHYME_211962>.
gujarati.context: The king of Gondal's kingdom was a simple and humble man who had been stuck in his village, but he took pride in being a Harijan (a Dalit community). His simplicity was reflected in the name "Hathi Bhai", which means brother with an elephant's strength.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
સખા સહિત સામા સહુ આવ્યા, અતિ હેતે પ્રભુ પધરાવ્યા; 
પછી બોલિયા શ્યામ સુજાણ<RHYME_211964>, તમે સાંભળો નરપતિ વાણ<RHYME_211964>.
gujarati.context: The righteous have arrived with God's blessing, and with great effort they have reached their destination; after that, Shyam Sugnaan said to the prince, "Now wait patiently."
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
અમે ત્યાગી ને રાજ્ય તમારે, કેમ મળશે તમારે અમારે; 
જેમ તમને રાજ્યની ખુમારી, તેમ ત્યાગીને ત્યાગની ભારી.
gujarati.context: We give up our kingdom to you, wondering how it will be for both of us; just as your kingdom's weariness is like ours' abandonment.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
માટે મોટા જો જાણો અમને, તો માનજ્યો જે કહીએ તમને; 
તૈયે જોડ્યા છે રાજાએ હાથ<RHYME_211968>, જેમ કહો તેમ કરશું નાથ<RHYME_211968>.
gujarati.context:
Know me well and I'll honor your words; 
Whatever you say, the king's hand is joined with mine.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પધાર્યા તેને ભુવન<RHYME_211969>, રહ્યા રાત્ય ને જમ્યા જીવન<RHYME_211969>; 
પછી શીખ માગીને સધાવ્યા, ધ્રોડ કરી ધોરાજીએ આવ્યા.
gujarati.context: After experiencing the bliss of heaven, one values life and makes efforts to achieve it; after gaining wisdom, one sets a path for oneself and reaches their destination.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
રહી રાત્ય ને સધાવ્યા શ્યામ<RHYME_211970>, ત્યાંથી આવ્યા છે ભાડેર ગામ<RHYME_211970>; 
ત્યાં નિજ જનને સુખ આપ્યાં, દેઈ દર્શન ને દુઃખ કાપ્યાં.
gujarati.context: In the village of Bhader, Shyam's night was spent, and from there he came with joy to his own people, giving them happiness. However, he brought sorrow by showing him (death) a glimpse of what is to come.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવ્યા માણાવદ્ર માંઈ<RHYME_211972>, રહ્યા રાત્ય એક પોતે ત્યાંઈ<RHYME_211972>; 
પછી ત્યાંથી પધાર્યા પંચાળે, દીધાં દાસને દર્શન દયાળે.
gujarati.context: After a long journey, I settled down alone at night, but then I left that place and took another route. I found the path of self-realization through the vision of the Lord.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં રહ્યા રાજી થઈ બહુ, આવ્યાં સાંભળી દર્શને સહુ; 
આખા અજાબ્ય ને અગત્રાઈ<RHYME_211975>, ગઢમઢ પિપ્પલ પોરછાઈ<RHYME_211975>.
gujarati.context: As the moments passed, my desire was fulfilled, and I saw the sight; now, my heart's curiosity is satisfied with this sweet encounter.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
મેઘપુર માંગરોળ લોજ<RHYME_211976>, કાલવાણી સમેધુ સુત્રોજ<RHYME_211976>; 
ગણોદ જાળિયું ઉપલેટું, આવે દર્શને ન જુવે છેટું.
gujarati.context: In the realm of heavenly beauty, one can't grasp the divine vision with a mortal mind. The celestial display is too magnificent to be comprehended by the limitations of human perception.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
બાલ જોબન ને વૃદ્ધ વળી, આવ્યાં પ્રભુ પધાર્યા સાંભળી; 
સહુ આવીને નીરખ્યા નાથ<RHYME_211968>, જોઈ જીવન થયા સનાથ<RHYME_211968>.
gujarati.context: A child's foolishness grows with age, and one day God will judge them for their mistakes; just like how we evaluate life after it's over.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
કરી પૂજા ને લાગ્યા છે પાય<RHYME_211979>, અતિ હેત હૈયામાં ન માય<RHYME_211979>; 
કહે કર જોડી એમ જન<RHYME_211980>, ઘણે દહાડે દીધાં દરશન<RHYME_211980>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The pleasure of worship has taken hold of my feet, yet I am not free from worldly desires; <summary>
Tell me, what can be done? We have seen many days and moments in contemplation.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહી ભર્યાં નીર નયણે, પછી પ્રભુ બોલ્યા મીઠે વયણે; 
સાંભળો સતસંગી સોરઠી, તમે સહુ સુખી છો સારી પઠી.
gujarati.context: The Lord says that after taking a bath in the nectar of devotion, one becomes sweet and pleasing to Him. Listen to the songs of the saints and you will become happy and content.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
અમે ફરીએ છીએ દેશ સહુ, પણ તમે વાલાં મને બહુ; 
અમે પ્રથમ પ્રકટ થઈ<RHYME_211983>, કરી આ દેશમાં લીલા કંઈ<RHYME_211983>.
gujarati.context: We are travelers passing through the land, but you have stayed with me so much. We first came to this country, and did something beautiful here.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
વળી આ દેશમાં સ્વામી મળ્યા, રામાનંદ જે ન જાય કળ્યા; 
તેના સતસંગી તમે કહાવો, માટે મારે મને અતિ ભાવો.
gujarati.context: In this land, I have found my Lord, Ramanaand; now share with me the company of the saints and let my heart be filled with devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
એવી સાંભળી વાલાની વાત<RHYME_211986>, સહુ થયાં અતિ રળિયાત<RHYME_211986>; 
પછી આવ્યો દુર્બળ એક દાસ<RHYME_211987>, અકિંચન નહિ વસ્ત્ર પાસ<RHYME_211987>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Listen carefully to a rich man's words, but then realize you've been deceived; later, you're left with nothing but worn-out clothes.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
તેને આપ્યાં અંબર કરાવી, વળી મૂઠડી મોરે ભરાવી; 
કાપ્યું દારિદ્ર એમ જનનું, હતું દુઃખ જે બહુ દનનું.
gujarati.context: The speaker has filled someone's life with sorrow and despair, like filling a pit with darkness; their poverty was born of too much suffering.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
બીજાં સહુ સુખી થયાં જન<RHYME_211980>, કરી પ્રભુજીનાં દર્શન<RHYME_211980>; 
દિન દશવીશ તિયાં રહ્યા, પછી ગામ પિપલાણે ગયા.
gujarati.context: Others became happy and prosperous with God's blessings; after spending 17 days, they returned to their village life.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
આખું અગત્રાઈ ગામ ફરી, પાછા પંચાળે આવિયા હરિ; 
રહી રાત્ય સવારે સધાવ્યા, ત્યાંથી માણાવદ્ર માંહિ આવ્યા.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The village was searched, but Hari was found at dawn; from there, he came to our city.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
દીધાં દાસને દર્શન દાન<RHYME_211991>, રહી રાત્ય ચાલ્યા ભગવાન<RHYME_211991>; 
આવ્યા જાળિયે સુંદર શ્યામ<RHYME_211970>, રહ્યા પહોર એક એહ ઠામ<RHYME_211970>.
gujarati.context: The Lord grants vision to those who seek Him, and at dawn, He remains in His abode. As the night ends, the beautiful Lord Shyam comes forth, remaining in this very temple.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી જને કરાવ્યાં ભોજન<RHYME_211980>, જમી ચાલિયા ત્યાંથી જીવન<RHYME_211969>;

gujarati.context: The saint Shyam is a bringer of happiness and sin-remover; he grants joy to the devotee, while others are consumed by sorrow and regret.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

gujarati.couplet:
જેણે બેસે જગતમાં દાગ<RHYME_212016>, એવાં કરાવ્યાં કુલક્ષણ ત્યાગ<RHYME_212016>; 
તેણે શોભે છે સતસંગ ઘણો, તે પ્રતાપ મહાપ્રભુ તણો.
gujarati.context: One who casts a shadow on the world is the one who ultimately leaves all their attachments; it's the noble soul who shines in sacred company, under the grandeur of God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૭૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે મહારાજે ગઢડેથી સર્વે હરિજનના ઉપર કાગળ લખ્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 75: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Gaḍhaḍethī Sarve Harijannā Upar Kāgaḷ Lakhyo

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Shyām Soraṭh padhāryā, janne man mod vadhāryā; <RHYME_1>
Gāme-gāmmā deī darshan, kare jannā man prasan.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: When Shyam Soraṭh is understood, joy fills the heart. Meeting people in villages brings joy to the soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Khambhāḷu Rāypar Pipaḷ, rahī Bandhiye gayā Gonḍaḷ; <RHYME_2>
Gām Gonḍaḷno je rājan, nām Haṭhībhāī harijan.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context:
The Khambha and Raipari people are tied to the Pipari village; 
In Gondal, there's a king named Hatheebhai Harijan.

transliteration.couplet:
Sakhā sahit sāmā sahu āvyā, ati hete Prabhu padharāvyā; <RHYME_3>
Pachhī boliyā Shyām sujāṇ, tame sāmbhaḷo narpati vāṇ.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The Lord is pleased when one walks with like-minded friends and has a simple heart. With humility and simplicity, one can become a king among humans.

transliteration.couplet:
Ame tyāgī ne rājya tamāre, kem maḷashe tamāre amāre; <RHYME_4>
Jem tamane rājyanī khumārī, tem tyāgīne tyāgnī bhārī.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context:
The queen's sacrifice is for the king's kingdom, and her love is equal to mine; 
Just as the king's intoxication is due to his kingdom, my devotion is burdened by my surrender.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe moṭā jo jāṇo amane, to mānajyo je kahīe tamane; <RHYME_5>
Taiye joḍyā chhe rājāe hāth, jem kaho tem karashu Nāth.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context:
When you know the truth, accept it with humility; 
Even if you have to carry out someone else's orders, do so with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī padhāryā tene bhuvan, rahyā rātya ne jamyā jīvan; <RHYME_6>
Pachhī shīkh māgīne sadhāvyā, dhroḍ karī Dhorājīe āvyā.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The universe's purpose was revealed to me, and I found eternal life; all my worries were solved in that instant.

All my doubts were cleared like clouds disappearing from the sky, as if Dhorājīe himself had spoken to me.

transliteration.couplet:
Rahī rātya ne sadhāvyā Shyām, tyāthī āvyā chhe Bhāḍer gām; <RHYME_7>
Tyā nij janne sukh āpyā, deī darshan ne dukh kāpyā.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context:
One's own home is the best, Shyam; that's why Bhāḍer's village is preferred.
Knowing oneself brings happiness, but seeing others' prosperity brings sorrow.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī āvyā Māṇāvadra māī, rahyā rātya ek pote tyāī; <RHYME_8>
Pachhī tyāthī padhāryā Panchāḷe, dīdhā dāsne darshan dayāḷe.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: A mother's love is unwavering and always present, like a flame that burns throughout the night. She shows kindness and mercy to her children, just as one would show respect to a guest.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā rahyā rājī thaī bahu, āvyā sāmbhaḷī darshane sahu; <RHYME_9>
Ākhā Ajābya ne Agatrāī, Gaḍhamaḍh Pippal Porchhāī.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: The couple's home was peaceful and calm, with a beautiful garden to behold; they had no worries or troubles, just enjoying each other's company. The phrase "Gaḍhamaḍh Pippal Porchhāī" suggests that their life was as serene as the gentle rustling of leaves under a pippal tree.

transliteration.couplet:
Meghpur Māngaroḷ Loj, Kālvāṇī Samedhu Sutroj; <RHYME_10>
Gaṇod Jāḷiyu Upleṭu, āve darshane na juve chheṭu.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a tranquil forest where trees are tall and leaves rustle with joy, but none can match the sight of a loving couple.

transliteration.couplet:
Bāl joban ne vṛuddha vaḷī, āvyā Prabhu padhāryā sāmbhaḷī; <RHYME_11>
Sahu āvīne nīrakhyā Nāth, joī jīvan thayā sanāth.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: A child's innocence is like a ripe fruit that is easily plucked by the Lord, and an adult's wisdom is like a precious stone that only comes with age. The Lord guides us through life, just as we would hold onto a boat to cross a river safely.

transliteration.couplet:
Karī pūjā ne lāgyā chhe pāy, ati het haiyāmā na māy; <RHYME_12>
Kahe kar joḍī em jan, ghaṇe dahāḍe dīdhā darashan.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The worship of the Lord has become a habit, yet I am not free from worldly attachments; only when my soul is united with His can I experience true freedom.

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahī bharyā nīr nayaṇe, pachhī Prabhu bolyā mīṭhe vayaṇe; <RHYME_13>
Sāmbhaḷo satasangī Soraṭhī, tame sahu sukhī chho sārī paṭhī.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: In a loving couple's home, the Lord takes care of their sweet words; In a community of saints, one finds true happiness and wisdom.

transliteration.couplet:
Ame farīe chhīe desh sahu, paṇ tame vālā mane bahu; <RHYME_14>
Ame pratham prakaṭ thaī, karī ā deshmā līlā kaī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The country is not mine, but I have many friends here; first of all, it's clear that this land has a playfulness.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī ā deshmā Swāmī maḷyā, Rāmānand je na jāy kaḷyā; <RHYME_15>
Tenā satasangī tame kahāvo, māṭe māre mane ati bhāvo.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: One's true home is where one's soul resides, and Ramanand doesn't wander elsewhere. In the company of saints, even the mind becomes calm and peaceful.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī sāmbhaḷī vālānī vāt, sahu thayā ati raḷiyāt; <RHYME_16>
Pachhī āvyo durbaḷ ek dās, akinchan nahi vastra pās.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: A strong gust of wind blows away one's worries and troubles. A distant servant is unable to obtain even a cloth from afar without permission.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene āpyā ambar karāvī, vaḷī mūṭhaḍī more bharāvī; <RHYME_17>
Kāpyu dāridra em jannu, hatu dukh je bahu dannu.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The heavens have created a situation where one is filled with worries and troubles are abundant. Such is the fate of those who are suffering from poverty, with sorrow and distress always in abundance.

transliteration.couplet:
Bījā sahu sukhī thayā jan, karī Prabhujīnā darshan; <RHYME_18>
Din dash-vīsh tiyā rahyā, pachhī gām Pipalāṇe gayā.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a farmer who is happy and content after seeing the divine vision of God, while others are left behind, wandering aimlessly like a pipal leaf blown away by the wind.

transliteration.couplet:
Ākhu Agatrāī gām farī, pāchhā Panchāḷe āviyā Hari; <RHYME_19>
Rahī rātya savāre sadhāvyā, tyāthī Māṇāvadra māhi āvyā.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The summary is: A person from Agatrāī village goes to the Panchāḷe festival, and in the evening, they meet God Hari. In the morning, they return home to their own village, having had a fulfilling experience with God.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīdhā dāsne darshan dān, rahī rātya chālyā Bhagwān; <RHYME_20>
Āvyā Jāḷiye sundar Shyām, rahyā pahor ek eh ṭhām.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: Granting a glimpse of the divine is a great blessing, as if God Himself has appeared; Beautiful Shyam resides in my heart at dawn and dusk.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī jane karāvyā bhojan, jamī chāliyā tyāthī jīvan; <RHYME_21>
Bīje rahyā nahi kiyā Nāth, āvyā Bandhiye sakhāne sāth.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context:
Summary: A couple's love and life revolve around sharing meals together; they are tied to each other like a tree is bound by its roots.

(Note: I've tried to preserve the essence of the Gujarati couplet in this summary, which is a poetic expression of the strong bond between two people.)

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāthī chālyā rangbhīno rāj, āvyā gām Gaḍhaḍe Mahārāj; <RHYME_22>
Dīdhā dāsne darshan dān, jane nīrakhyā bhāve Bhagwān.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The king of Gaḍhaḍe Mahārāj is a colorful and lively ruler. One should seek an audience with God, for it's only through His mercy that one can overcome the darkness of ignorance.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī pūchhyu jane lāgī pāy, kevā satasangī Soraṭh māy; <RHYME_23>
Kaho kṛupā karīne amane, kevu het karatā tamane.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The speaker has grown fond of a distant friend and longs to be with them, seeking solace in their companionship; they ask if it's possible for the friend to show mercy and meet them.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī boliyā prāṇ jīvan, tame sāmbhaḷo sahu maḷī jan; <RHYME_24>
Soraṭh deshnā satasangī jeh, ati nirmaḷ komaḷ teh.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context:
Life is like a pomegranate, with moments of joy and sadness; may one's spiritual journey be filled with the sweetness of self-realization.

In community with others, one finds solace and peace in the midst of life's trials and tribulations.

transliteration.couplet:
Nahi chhaḷ kapaṭ lagārya, bahu vishvāsī chhe nar-nārya; <RHYME_25>
Ghaṇu nahi ḍahāpaṇ chaturāī, nishchay Prabhuno parvat prāī.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: Men and women should not be overly proud, for it is a sign of great doubt in one's own self; instead, have faith in God's will and accept the path He has chosen.

transliteration.couplet:
Je dinā ene Swāmī maḷyā chhe, te dinā sarve sanshay ṭaḷyā chhe; <RHYME_26>
Nirutthān chhe nar ne nārī, ek ekthī samajaṇye bhārī.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: The day I am with my Lord is a day without worries, and that day all anxieties are gone. In this world, men and women are different, but the understanding of God is equally important for both.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā jan thoḍā maḷe jote, jene maḷyā Rāmānand pote; <RHYME_27>
Tyāre jan kahe satya Mahārāj, evā jan nahi bījā āj.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The saying goes that when a person is strong and capable, they can bear the weight of Ramanand's teachings; only then does one know the truth about Mahārāj.

transliteration.couplet:
Jenā tame karo chho vakhāṇ, e to evā ja chhe paramāṇ; <RHYME_28>
Em Hari harijan maḷī, karī vāt te sarve sāmbhaḷī.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a woman's words, which are considered more precious than anything else. Her sweet speech can soothe everyone's soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Em nitya navī vāto kare, suṇī jan hṛude sahu dhare; <RHYME_29>
Em kartā vītyo ek mās, pachhī Prabhujī thayā udās.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks about the constant flow of thoughts in one's mind, and how it's hard to calm them down, just like a strong wind that cannot be stopped. Even if you try to control your mind for a month, it will again become restless, yearning for the ultimate truth.

transliteration.couplet:
Līdho sevak ek sanghātye, ūṭhī chālyā pote aradhī rātye; <RHYME_30>
Gaḍhaḍāthī uttarmā gām, rahe satasangī Sukhpur nām.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: A devotee is a companion of the Lord's court, and at night, they depart to their own home; meanwhile, their true companion remains in the city of Sukhpur.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā padhāryā darshan devā, tene gher hato vaḷī vivā; <RHYME_31>
Tiyā maḷyā hatā nar-nār, dīṭhā unmatta sarakhā apār.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The divine encounter is with the one who has departed from the world, and not with those who are still stuck in worldly desires. The madman's words are more meaningful than the wise man's empty phrases.

transliteration.couplet:
Nahi kene vichār vivek, chaḍyo kef vivāno vishek; <RHYME_32>
Kare māhomāhi bahu hāsī, evu joīne thayā udāsī.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: Without self-reflection and wisdom, one gets entangled in vain debates. Laughter and joy are short-lived when one is consumed by the futility of their endeavors.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā hatā udāsī ṭāḷavā, tyā to sāmunā adhikā havā; <RHYME_33>
Paṇ kahyu nahi kene kāī, Prabhu samajī rahyā man māī.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context:
The couplet describes the pain of separation from a loved one, where even the wind seems to carry their fragrance more than the beloved's absence; yet, one cannot help but think of them constantly.

Their love is so strong that it overshadows all else.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī tarta tyāthī ūṭhī chālyā, rahyā nahi Nāth kenā zālyā; <RHYME_34>
Kahe ame jāshu dūr desh, pāchho yā nahi karīe pravesh.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The summary is: The Lord does not enter where He is not invited, just as a guest does not go to a distant land without an invitation.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī harijane joḍyā hāth, evu karavu nahi mārā Nāth; <RHYME_35>
Hoy jīvmā avaguṇ ghaṇā, joyā na ghaṭe Nāth te taṇā.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context:
One who is guided by the Lord's hand will not be destroyed; similarly, one's life moments are not wasted with God as their protector.

This life's joys and sorrows do not go in vain when the Lord is our guiding force.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe dayāḷu dayā karīne, āvo gāmmā pāchhā farīne; <RHYME_36>
Pachhī Prabhu kahe sāmbhaḷo tame, jāo jarūr āvashu ame.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context:
God's mercy will forgive us in the end, but till then we must account for our past actions.
The Lord says, "Don't worry, you'll go to hell if you don't mend your ways."

transliteration.couplet:
Paṇ ā paḷe pāchhā vaḷīne, nahi āvīe māno maḷīne; <RHYME_37>
Pachhī tyā thakī pote sadhāvyā, āghā jaīne Gaḍhaḍe āvyā.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the consequences of procrastination, where one delays and regret sets in when it's too late. It emphasizes that putting things off will only lead to difficulty and sorrow.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvī lakhāvyo kāgaḷ ek, temā eṭalo lakhyo vivek; <RHYME_38>
Āpaṇā je satasangī hoy, te to bhānḍ bhavāī na joy.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: One's own mistakes are many and varied, but discernment is rare among the wise; true friendship with others brings neither happiness nor sorrow.

transliteration.couplet:
Sānkhya-yogī hoy bāī bhāī, tene jāvu nahi vivā māī; <RHYME_39>
Karma-yogī je jāy vivāy, te paṇ gīt Prabhujīnā gāy.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: A Sānkhya-yogī is like a brother or friend, never separating from his wife; whereas a Karma-yogī is one who separates himself and sings the praises of Lord Krishna's glories.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh āganyā chhe jo amārī, sahu rahejyo em nar-nārī; <RHYME_40>
Em nahi rahe jan jeh, nahi amārā satasangī teh.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context:
The one who is with me is my wife, and she should always be by my side; 
For without her, life would not be worth living, nor would our friendship be complete.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī lakhāvī kāgaḷe vāt, pachhī pote thayā raḷiyāt; <RHYME_41>
Thayā rājī pote tyāre rāj, jyāre kīdhu chhe eṭalu kāj.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The wind blows fiercely in the forest, but the brave one stands firm; The king of peace is pleased with the one who conquers their own tasks.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā sant sukhdāyī Shyām, dās doṣh nivāraṇ nām; <RHYME_42>
Shobhānidhi te santane āpī, bījā kalank sarave kāpī.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Lord Shyam (Krishna) brings peace and bliss, and removes all faults; He is present in the devotee's heart, filling it with beauty and purity.

transliteration.couplet:
Jeṇe bese jagatmā dāg, evā karāvyā kulakṣhaṇ tyāg; <RHYME_43>
Teṇe shobhe chhe satasang ghaṇo, te pratāp mahāprabhu taṇo.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: One's attachment to worldly desires is like a fire that burns away one's spirituality; it's best to abandon it as soon as possible. Those who renounce such attachments will be adorned with the divine company and attain great glory under the Lord's guidance.
